member.name: T:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver
member.summary:
DNS resolver, as defined in:
RFC 1034: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1034: DOMAIN NAMES - CONCEPTS AND FACILITIES RFC 1035: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1035: DOMAIN NAMES - IMPLEMENTATION AND SPECIFICATION RFC 2782: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2782: A DNS RR for specifying the location of services (DNS SRV) RFC 3596: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3596: DNS Extensions to Support IP Version 6 RFC 5782: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5782: DNS Blacklists and Whitelists RFC 7208: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7208: Sender Policy Framework (SPF) for Authorizing Use of Domains in Email, Version 1

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.IsValidArpanetHostName(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a host name is a valid ARPHANET host name.
member.returns: If is a valid ARPHANET host name.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.Resolve(System.String,Waher.Networking.DNS.Enumerations.QTYPE,Waher.Networking.DNS.Enumerations.QCLASS)
member.exception: If the domain name could not be resolved for the TYPE and CLASS provided.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.Resolve(System.String,Waher.Networking.DNS.Enumerations.QTYPE,System.Nullable{Waher.Networking.DNS.Enumerations.TYPE},Waher.Networking.DNS.Enumerations.QCLASS)
member.param: If no answer of type is found, records of this type can also be accepted.
member.exception: If the domain name could not be resolved for the TYPE and CLASS provided.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.LookupIP4Addresses(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up the IPv4 addresses related to a given domain name.
member.returns: IPv4 address found related to the domain name.
member.exception: If the name does not exist.
If the name could not be resolved.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.LookupIP6Addresses(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up the IPv6 addresses related to a given domain name.
member.returns: IPv6 address found related to the domain name.
member.exception: If the name does not exist.
If the name could not be resolved.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.LookupMailExchange(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up the Mail Exchanges related to a given domain name.
member.returns: Mail Exchanges found related to the domain name.
member.exception: If the name does not exist.
If the name could not be resolved.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.AddressToName(System.Net.IPAddress,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts an IP Address to a domain name for reverse IP lookup, or DNSBL lookup.
member.exception: If Address Type does not have a corresponding domain name.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.LookupDomainName(System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary:
Looks up the domain name pointing to a specific IP address.
Note: The response is not necessarily unique or authoritative.
member.returns: Domain Name pointing to the address

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.LookupText(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up text (TXT) records for a name.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.LookupBlackList(System.Net.IPAddress,System.String)
member.summary: Looks up an IP Address in a DNS Block List.
member.returns: null, if IP Address is NOT on list. Otherwise, it contains the reasons why it is on the list.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.LookupServiceEndpoint(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Looks up a service endpoint for a domain. If multiple are available, an appropriate one is selected as defined by RFC 2782.
member.exception: If service endpoint could not be resolved.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.LookupServiceEndpoints(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Looks up a available service endpoints for a domain.
member.exception: If service endpoint could not be resolved.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.DnsResolver.CheckHost(System.Net.IPAddress,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Checks if a client is authorized to operate under a given domain name. This is done by evaluating SPF records for the domain, in accordance with:
RFC 7208: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7208: Sender Policy Framework (SPF) for Authorizing Use of Domains
member.param: the IP address of the client that wants to operate under a given domain.
The domain that provides the sought-after authorization information; initially, the domain portion of the "MAIL FROM" or "HELO" identity (for SMTP).
The claimed sender (in SMTO: the "MAIL FROM" or "HELO" identity).
Domain as presented by the client during initial hndshake (in SMTP, the HELO or EHLO command).
Domain of the current host, performing SPF authentication.
member.returns: Result of SPF evaluation, together with an optional explanation string, if one exists, and if the result indicates a failure.

member.name: T:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.A
member.summary: This mechanism matches if <ip> is one of the <target-name>'s IP addresses.For clarity, this means the "a" mechanism also matches AAAA records.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.A.#ctor(Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Term,Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfQualifier)
member.summary: This mechanism matches if <ip> is one of the <target-name>'s IP addresses.For clarity, this means the "a" mechanism also matches AAAA records.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.A.Matches
member.summary: Checks if the mechamism matches the current request.

member.name: T:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.All
member.summary: The "all" mechanism is a test that always matches. It is used as the rightmost mechanism in a record to provide an explicit default.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.All.#ctor(Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Term,Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfQualifier)
member.summary: The "all" mechanism is a test that always matches. It is used as the rightmost mechanism in a record to provide an explicit default.

member.summary: Checks if the mechamism matches the current request.

member.name: T:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.Exists
member.summary: This mechanism is used to construct an arbitrary domain name that is used for a DNS A record query.It allows for complicated schemes involving arbitrary parts of the mail envelope to determine what is permitted.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.Exists.#ctor(Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Term,Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfQualifier)
member.summary: This mechanism is used to construct an arbitrary domain name that is used for a DNS A record query.It allows for complicated schemes involving arbitrary parts of the mail envelope to determine what is permitted.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.Exists.Matches
member.summary: Checks if the mechamism matches the current request.

member.name: T:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.Exp
member.summary: If check_host() results in a "fail" due to a mechanism match (such as "-all"), and the "exp" modifier is present, then the explanation string returned is computed as described below.If no "exp" modifier is present, then either a default explanation string or an empty explanation string MUST be returned to the calling application.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.Exp.#ctor(Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Term,Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfQualifier)
member.summary: If check_host() results in a "fail" due to a mechanism match (such as "-all"), and the "exp" modifier is present, then the explanation string returned is computed as described below.If no "exp" modifier is present, then either a default explanation string or an empty explanation string MUST be returned to the calling application.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.Exp.Matches
member.summary: Checks if the mechamism matches the current request.

member.name: T:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.Include
member.summary: The "include" mechanism triggers a recursive evaluation of check_host().

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.Include.Matches

member.name: T:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Mechanisms.Redirect
member.summary: The "redirect" modifier is intended for consolidating both authorizations and policy into a common set to be shared within a single ADMD.It is possible to control both authorized hosts and policy for an arbitrary number of domains from a single record.

member.name: T:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResolver
member.summary:
Resolves a SPF string, as defined in:
RFC 7208: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7208: Sender Policy Framework (SPF) for Authorizing Use of Domains in Email, Version 1

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResolver.CheckHost(System.Net.IPAddress,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Fetches SPF records, parses them, and evaluates them to determine whether a particular host is or is not permitted to send mail with a given identity.
member.param: the IP address of the SMTP client that is emitting the mail, either IPv4 or IPv6.
The domain that provides the sought-after authorization information; initially, the domain portion of the "MAIL FROM" or "HELO" identity.
Domain as presented by the client in the HELO or EHLO command.
Domain of the current host, performing SPF authentication.
member.returns: Result of SPF evaluation, together with an optional explanation string, if one exists, and if the result indicates a failure.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResolver.CheckHost(Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Term)
member.summary: Fetches SPF records, parses them, and evaluates them to determine whether a particular host is or is not permitted to send mail with a given identity.
member.returns: Result of SPF evaluation, together with an optional explanation string, if one exists, and if the result indicates a failure.

member.name: T:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResult
member.summary: Result of a SPF (Sender Policy Framework) evaluation.

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResult.None
member.summary: A result of "none" means either (a) no syntactically valid DNS domain name was extracted from the SMTP session that could be used as the one to be authorized, or (b) no SPF records were retrieved from the DNS.

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResult.Neutral
member.summary: A "neutral" result means the ADMD has explicitly stated that it is not asserting whether the IP address is authorized.

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResult.Pass
member.summary: A "pass" result is an explicit statement that the client is authorized to inject mail with the given identity.

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResult.Fail
member.summary: A "fail" result is an explicit statement that the client is not authorized to use the domain in the given identity.

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResult.SoftFail
member.summary: A "softfail" result is a weak statement by the publishing ADMD that the host is probably not authorized. It has not published a stronger, more definitive policy that results in a "fail".

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResult.TemporaryError
member.summary: A "temperror" result means the SPF verifier encountered a transient (generally DNS) error while performing the check. A later retry may succeed without further DNS operator action.

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfResult.PermanentError
member.summary: A "permerror" result means the domain's published records could not be correctly interpreted. This signals an error condition that definitely requires DNS operator intervention to be resolved.

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfQualifier.Pass
member.summary: If a mechanism matches, it results in a pass

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfQualifier.Fail
member.summary: If a mechanism matches, it results in a fail

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfQualifier.SoftFail
member.summary: If a mechanism matches, it results in a softFail

member.name: F:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.SpfQualifier.Neutral
member.summary: If a mechanism matches, it results in a neutral

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Term.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Net.IPAddress,System.String,System.String)
member.param: The domain that provides the sought-after authorization information; initially, the domain portion of the "MAIL FROM" or "HELO" identity.
the IP address of the SMTP client that is emitting the mail, either IPv4 or IPv6.
Domain as presented by the client in the HELO or EHLO command.
Domain of the current host, performing SPF authentication.

member.name: M:Waher.Networking.DNS.SPF.Term.Reset(System.String)
member.summary: Resets the string representation of the term.
